Dorsey Image 30 of 63 Presidio, Texas Stay at Chinati Hot Springs Resort In the corner of Big Bend is this beautiful oasis and "luxury resort" that's more rustic than it is fancy. Which is a good thing. It's the soaking spots and serenity that should be appreciated in this West Texas spot. less Presidio, Texas Stay at Chinati Hot Springs Resort In the corner of Big Bend is this beautiful oasis and "luxury resort" that's more rustic than it is fancy. Photo: John Gonzalez, CHRONICLE Image 42 of 63 Marathon, Texas Stay at the Gage Hotel Built in 1927 by architect Henry Trost, the Western-elegant accommodation is a two-story, five bedroom, white classic colonial home with four common rooms. Marathon, Texas Stay at the Gage Hotel Built in 1927 by architect Henry Trost, the Western-elegant accommodation is a two-story, five bedroom, white classic colonial home with four common rooms. Photo: Gage Hotel Image 43 of 63 Marathon, Texas Stay at the Gage Hotel The historic hotel also has a carriage house with two additional bedrooms; rooms can be booked individually or you can book the whole place in its entirety. Go to Love Creek Orchards Called the "Apple Capital of Texas," you'll want to make time for some apple picking or to go to the annual Apple Festival. Photo: Courtesy Of Love Creek Orchards Image 53 of 63 Medina, Texas Go to The Medina River for kayaking Near Bandera, this small town's river doesn't have the crowds that other main waterways in that state boast. So it's a great place for kayaking or relaxing. Photo: Bob Ruggiero Image 63 of 63 The under-the-radar gems of Texas worth traveling to this spring break 1 / 63 Back to Gallery There are 268,580 square miles of land and water in the great Lone Star State. With it being the second largest state in America, there are a lot of beautiful places to see in Texas.
Though the plethora of national and state parks are littered throughout the countrysides, hills, plains and deserts of Texas, there is usually a longing to go to a new and unique place. Luckily, there are a plethora of places in Texas that are hidden gems.
TEXAS COOLNESS: Photos of Austin when it was cool before it was 'cool'
From Big Bend to the Guadalupe Mountains, check out the most beautiful places in Texas.
Media: Dr. Oz The Good Life From the Salt Basin Dunes to Gorman Falls, Texas' natural sites are nothing short of amazing. Spring break is coming up for students, so if you're wanting to travel during that time, start planning with the gallery above of the best under-the-radar places in Texas.
TEXAS HISTORY: The evolution of a West Texas oil town
